You can use `ign-common` as a blueprint.

First, in `release-tools/jenkins-scripts`, create `ign_sensors-default-devel-windows-amd64.bat`, and make it look like [ign_common-default-devel-windows-amd64.bat](#!/osrf/release-tools/src/323f44868479d2537e58c3869ab6172b21534815/jenkins-scripts/ign_common-default-devel-windows-amd64.bat?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default), but replace the line `set VCS_DIRECTORY=ign-common` with `set VCS_DIRECTORY=ign-sensors`. That should be the only difference.

Then, in [ign-sensors/configure.bat](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/src/6d77a539caae2801fe4df057a9240da73eb99563/configure.bat?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default), make it look like [ign-common/configure.bat](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/7a9b1ee092b5e7419722cd9de5dd205a56c09fba/configure.bat?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default), except you can remove line 7 since `ign-sensors` doesn't need `dl-win32`. You'll also want to remove line 8 and replace it with:

```
call %win_lib% :install_ign_project ign-transport
call %win_lib% :install_ign_project ign-common
call %win_lib% :install_ign_project ign-rendering
```

However, this assumes that `ign-transport` and `ign-rendering` both have `ign-cmake` support and follow this Windows CI, which is not the case yet. We'll need to update those dependencies to the new Windows CI procedure before we can get it going on `ign-sensors`.

call %win_lib% :install_ign_project ign-transport
call %win_lib% :install_ign_project ign-common

However, this assumes that ign-transport and ign-rendering both have ign-cmake support and follow this Windows CI, which is not the case yet. We'll need to update those dependencies to the new Windows CI procedure before we can get it going on ign-sensors.
